comment:
* Enables try-with-resources compatible StrictMode violation allowlisting. * * Prefer "ignored" as the variable name to appease Android Studio's "Unused symbol" inspection. * * Example: * 
 *     try (StrictModeContext ignored = StrictModeContext.allowDiskWrites()) {
 *         return Example.doThingThatRequiresDiskWrites();
 *     }
 *
*

methods.name: public static StrictModeContext allowAllVmPolicies()
methods.comment:
* Convenience method for disabling all VM-level StrictMode checks with try-with-resources.
     * Includes everything listed here:
     *     https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/StrictMode.VmPolicy.Builder.html

methods.name: public static StrictModeContext allowAllThreadPolicies()
methods.comment:
* Convenience method for disabling all thread-level StrictMode checks with try-with-resources.
     * Includes everything listed here:
     *     https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/StrictMode.ThreadPolicy.Builder.html

methods.name: public static StrictModeContext allowDiskWrites()
methods.comment: Convenience method for disabling StrictMode for disk-writes with try-with-resources.

methods.name: public static StrictModeContext allowDiskReads()
methods.comment: Convenience method for disabling StrictMode for disk-reads with try-with-resources.

methods.name: public static StrictModeContext allowSlowCalls()
methods.comment: Convenience method for disabling StrictMode for slow calls with try-with-resources.

methods.name: public static StrictModeContext allowUnbufferedIo()
methods.comment:
* Convenience method for disabling StrictMode for unbuffered input/output operations with
     * try-with-resources.
     * For API level 25- this method will do nothing;
     * because StrictMode.ThreadPolicy.Builder#permitUnbufferedIo is added in API level 26.
